message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.CR, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with a network coded handover in IEEE 802.11, which is a wireless networking standard. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also proposes a novel model for the Distributed Coordination Function (DCF) of the WiFi IEEE 802.11, which involves information theory and coding, making cs.IT (Information Theory) another likely sub-category. The paper also analyzes the delay over all, unicast and broadcast transmissions, which involves multimedia systems and applications, making cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category. The paper also discusses the performance of different mechanisms, which involves security and cryptography, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper provides a novel formulation of the Network Coding on the Edge handover when the station is mobile, which involves control systems and optimization, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
